message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and biopsy results suggest a diagnosis of nasopharyngeal carcinoma, which is associated with Epstein-Barr virus. Among the options, only Burkitt lymphoma is also associated with Epstein-Barr virus. Adult T-cell lymphoma is associated with human T-lymphotropic virus, Kaposi sarcoma with human herpesvirus 8, and vulvar carcinoma with human papillomavirus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and biopsy findings suggest nasopharyngeal carcinoma, which is strongly associated with Epstein-Barr virus (EBV). Among the options, Burkitt lymphoma is also associated with EBV infection. Adult T-cell lymphoma is associated with human T-lymphotropic virus (HTLV-1), Kaposi sarcoma is associated with human herpesvirus 8 (HHV-8), and vulvar carcinoma is not commonly associated with viral infections.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and biopsy results suggest that the patient has nasopharyngeal carcinoma, which is commonly associated with the Epstein-Barr virus. Among the options, only Burkitt lymphoma is also associated with Epstein-Barr virus. Adult T-cell lymphoma is associated with human T-cell lymphotropic virus type 1, Kaposi sarcoma is associated with human herpesvirus 8, and vulvar carcinoma is associated with human papillomavirus.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and biopsy results suggest nasopharyngeal carcinoma. This type of cancer is strongly associated with Epstein-Barr virus, which is also associated with Burkitt lymphoma. Adult T-cell lymphoma is associated with human T-lymphotropic virus type 1, Kaposi sarcoma is associated with human herpesvirus 8, and vulvar carcinoma may be associated with human papillomavirus, but none of these are associated with Epstein-Barr virus.
